result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan K Wehland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Contempt of Court/Disobey Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.01(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bond on file in this case and 15CM831 shall be applied to amounts due. Remaining amounts due to be paid as a condition of probation on count #2.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: count #1.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond on file in this case and 15CM831 shall be applied to amounts due. If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with S.L.O. (dob 4-30-01) or Arbor Trace Apartments or be within 1000 feet thereof.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan K Wehland
